Utterance: Hi, welcome back! How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I've been okay, I guess. A little up and down, but mostly okay.
I'm glad to hear that. Last time, we talked about your job search and some feelings of guilt around productivity. Have you made any progress on that front?
Yeah, I actually sent out a few more resumes this week. It felt good to take that step, even though I still feel a bit overwhelmed.
That's a great step! How did it feel to send those resumes out?
It felt relieving but also a little nerve-wracking. I just keep worrying about whether I’ll hear back or if I’ll even get an interview.
It’s completely normal to feel that way. Let’s explore that a bit more. What specific worries come up for you when you think about hearing back from potential employers?
I guess I worry that I’m not good enough or that I won’t stand out among the other applicants.
Those thoughts can be really tough to deal with. Have you noticed any patterns in how you respond to those feelings of inadequacy?
Yeah, I tend to shut down a bit. I’ll start second-guessing myself and then I don’t want to apply to more jobs.
That sounds frustrating. What do you think might help you combat those feelings when they arise?
I think reminding myself of my strengths could help. I mean, I’ve worked hard and have a lot of experience, but sometimes it just feels overshadowed by self-doubt.
That’s a good realization. Would you be open to creating a list of your strengths and accomplishments to refer back to when those doubts creep in?
Yeah, I think that could be really helpful.
Great! We can work on that together. You mentioned feeling overwhelmed—what else has been contributing to that feeling lately?
Well, I’ve still been having those weird dreams and sleep issues. It’s hard to focus when I’m not well-rested.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI): Physiological Observations

Utterance: Sleep can have such a big impact on our mood and clarity. Have you tried any strategies to improve your sleep since we last spoke?
I’ve tried some deep breathing before bed, but I’m not consistent with it. Some nights I just forget.
It can be hard to remember to practice self-care when you’re feeling overwhelmed. Would you be willing to set a reminder on your phone for a few minutes of deep breathing before bedtime?
That sounds doable. I could try that.
Wonderful! Also, how about your family? You mentioned enjoying your time with them during the holidays. Have you had a chance to connect with them since?
Yeah, I talked to my mom last week. It was nice to catch up.
That’s great! What did you talk about?
Just the usual stuff—how things are going with me and how she’s doing. She always asks about my job search, and I think she worries.
It sounds like she cares a lot about you. Do you feel supported by her during this time?
Mostly, yeah. Sometimes I feel like she doesn’t quite understand the industry, but I appreciate her concern.
It’s understandable to feel that way. Have you thought about sharing more about your experiences with her to help her understand?
I haven’t, but that could be a good idea. Maybe if I explain the challenges, she wouldn’t worry so much.
That could be very helpful for both of you. It could also strengthen your relationship.
Yeah, I think so too.
As we wrap up today’s session, let’s set some goals for the next week. You mentioned sending out resumes, working on your strengths list, and trying deep breathing. How does that sound?
That sounds good! I’ll try to do all of that.
Excellent! I look forward to hearing how it goes in our next session. Remember to be kind to yourself during this process.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate it!
You’re welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next week.
Bye!
